intro: Erigeron superbus, commonly known as the showy fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows and grasslands, and it thrives in full sun. Its foliage is hairy and gray-green, with white or pale blue flowers that bloom in late summer. Erigeron superbus is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
